data.title: Lucifer Morningstar

data.text:
If the devil can be redeemed, then anyone can.   Lucifer

in "Partners 'Til the End"

Lucifer Morningstar, formerly known as Samael as well as his nickname, the Light-Bringer, is the titular protagonist of Lucifer. He is an Archangel and the younger identical twin brother of Michael. Following a failed rebellion against his Father, Lucifer was banished from Heaven and forced to oversee the torture of damned Human souls for eons as the Ruler of Hell. During his time as the King of Hell, Lucifer tempted Eve in the Garden of Eden, leading to Eve and her husband Adam being banished to live on Earth for the rest of their lives. After some visits to Earth, He would reunite with his old friend, Lilith in 1946 to help her find her ring. Lucifer was ultimately gifted the ring, along with Lilith's Immortality. Widely known as the Devil or Satan by Humans, Lucifer is blamed for the sins of mankind.

On one of Lucifer visits to Earth in 2011, he assisted Amenadiel in finding his necklace and eventually decided to abdicate his throne to become a nightclub owner in Los Angeles, operating an establishment called Lux. He forced his eldest brother to oblige due to the deal he made with him to help find his necklace and had his closest friend and senior lieutenant, Mazikeen join him, owing John Constantine a favor for helping her leave Hell during their search for the necklace. After having Maze cut his wings off, he repaid that favor during the Anti-Monitor Crisis before the Multiverse was destroyed and later reborn, allowing the former King of Hell to continue his carefree life.

Lucifer's life took a turn after he witnessed the murder of his friend Delilah. Feeling compelled to find the killer, he attached himself to Detective Chloe Decker, and ultimately solved the case with her. He manipulated his way into becoming a consultant for the LAPD, which gave him an outlet to punish evil doers on Earth instead of Hell. Lucifer also started seeking therapy from Linda Martin, temporarily becoming a lover. His relationship with the Detective becomes more intimate, after shockingly realizing that he becomes vulnerable in her pressence. He gets into conflict with Amenadiel, who seeks to bring him back to Hell, only for the brothers to team up to stop the corrupt cop, Malcolm Graham, after the latter resurrected him in a misguided attempt to do God's will. In an effort to protect Chloe, Lucifer was mortally wounded by Malcolm and before dying, makes a deal with God to protect Chloe in exchange for being a loyal son. Briefly returning to Hell, he is shown that his Mother escaped Her cell. His death is then reversed by God and after sending Malcolm back to Hell, he interprets what he saw as his part of the deal: return Goddess to Hell.

After a long search for Goddess, they finally reunite, only for him to instead condemn Her to live among the Humans She despised as a loophole to punish Her so they could reconnect. Her presence eventually brought the attention of Uriel, forcing Lucifer to eradicate him with the Blade of Death to save Goddess and Chloe. Needing actual assistance from Linda because of this, he reveals his true self to her, causing her to distance herself from him, before eventually resuming their sessions. Lucifer and Chloe almost started a relationship before he discovered that God put her in his path for unknown reasons, causing him to break off any affection he has for her to protect her. When he learned his Mother's plan to return to Heaven to face God, he agreed to help reassemble the Flaming Sword, but his intention was to return Her home and have his parents fight it out as vengeance for their manipulations. However, realizing that their actions would culminate in a civil war, resulting in numerous of his siblings dead, he went against Goddess, and instead used the sword to cut through space itself, giving his Mother the opportunity to form Her own universe. This selfless act resulted in Lucifer unknowingly self-actualizing his wings back.

With his wings returned and his Devil face gone, Lucifer believed that a master criminal known as The Sinnerman was behind it all and set out to punish him. He also started a friendship with Charlotte Richards after her experience in Hell left her broken. After a long chase and misdirection, Lucifer learned that the LAPD's new lieutenant was not only the Sinnerman, but the world's first murderer, Cain, but had nothing to do with his latest conundrum. This led Lucifer to think that God did it all to foil Cain's plans, so Lucifer set out to help get rid of his mark so he could finally die before deciding to dissolve it when it put Chloe in jeopardy. He soon grew jealous when Cain and Chloe started dating, and later became engaged, so decided to tell her how he felt, but backed out when the latter called it off. After Cain murdered Charlotte and Amenadiel regained his wings, Lucifer realized that all the changes to his body were his doing, believing he deserved what he got. Once Lucifer finally killed Cain, his Devil face returned, as he believed he was a monster once again for breaking God's number one rule of not killing Humans. just as Chloe witnessed it.

Lucifer's relationship with Chloe took a turn after she initially betrayed him to send him back to Hell with the help of Father William Kinley. Though Chloe realized she was wrong, Lucifer couldn't bring himself to forgive her, and things only got worse when Eve showed up and the two resumed their former relationship. Lucifer and Chloe eventually reconciled and he returned to consulting for the LAPD. Unfortunately, because of Eve's influence, Lucifer started inflicting serious punishment on the guilty, before he realized what he was becoming and broke up with her to prevent a world ending prophecy. However, the prophecy came true when Demons started invading L.A., forcing Lucifer to return to Hell to keep them in line. Before leaving, Lucifer and Chloe admitted their feelings for each other and he resumed his rule over Hell.

Two months later (which, in Hell's time, were actually millennia), Lucifer was forced to return when Michael started wreaking havoc on Earth. His relationship with Chloe took another turn after she learned of her divine birth, and his own confidence was shattered when he discovered Michael manipulated him since the beginning. Lucifer and Chloe, however, were able to see past their issues and finally became a couple. However, Lucifer's mojo passed on to her, and he became invulnerable again whilst in the presence of his girlfriend, causing conflict in their new relationship. After Chloe was kidnapped by his twin and subsequently rescued, Lucifer was forced to finally confront his true feelings for her but was halted when Michael and Maze attacked him and Amenadiel. Their sibling squabble was broken up, however, when God showed up. After spending some quality time with God, Lucifer learned that He was going to retire, leading to a war between him and Michael over who would take His place, the former becoming determined to win after Michael caused Dan Espinoza's death. Though it seemed Michael was victorious after killing Chloe, Lucifer sacrificed himself to resurrect her from Heaven, finally admitting his love for her. Lucifer's selfless action resulted in his own resurrection as the new God with all present taking a knee before him.

After weeks of procrastination, feeling that he is not the right person for the job, Lucifer abandoned his decision to become God. He is surprised when his future daughter, Aurora Morningstar, confronts him from her Timeline for answers on why he abandoned her and Chloe. Despite not being able to figure out why, Lucifer proved that he loved Rory and would never leave her intentionally, leading to their reconciliation. After helping Dan to deal with his guilt and ascend into Heaven as well as dissuading Aurora from killing Vincent Le Mec, Lucifer returns to Hell to help heal the damned souls of Hell so that they too could be redeemed. Decades later, after dying of old age, Chloe is reunited with Lucifer in Hell, willingly joining him as his eternal partner in Lucifer's mission.

Biography

History

Creation

Samael was one of the many Angels born to God and Goddess after the Big Bang, billions of years ago[1], but is special as not only is he an Archangel,[2] but also because of his status as "The Lightbringer,"[3] becoming the "brightest of all God's Angels."[4] He was also the younger twin of Mi-ka-el,[5] but due to Samael's stature, the brothers grew to despise each other, his elder twin changing his name to Michael, not wanting it to rhyme with Samael's.[6]

Growing Up In Heaven

As an young Angel, he and his siblings admired, respected, and even feared their eldest brother, Amenadiel. He played and trained with his siblings, however, he and the other elder Angels often excluded Uriel from their activities.[7] Due to this, Uriel would pull pranks on Samael.[8] He was very close to his younger sister Azrael, nicknaming her Rae-Rae, and enjoyed pranking Amenadiel with her.[9] He was, however, jealous of his brother Hanjobadiel being considered the "handsomest of them all."[10]

Becoming The Devil

Samael's Heavenly Rebellion

Samael coveted free will, like humanity, and chose to rebel against God, who he viewed as controlling.[1] He told God directly that he was going to start a rebellion, but his Father just found it adorable.[11] Samael, changing his name to Lucifer in defiance of their Father, led his vast rebellion; Angels like Saraqael assisted him.[12]

Banished to Hell

His rebellion ended in failure and he was cast down to Hell by God, banished from ever returning to Heaven or else be incinerated upon his return.[13] He was tasked to be its sovereign and to punish the souls of deceased sinners for all eternity.[14] When he landed in Hell, he discovered he had a monstrous face when he looked into a mirror and believed it was God punishing him for his rebellion.[15] Lucifer's reign would not be in solitude, as when his old friend Lilith gave birth to her children: thousands of Demons, she sent them to Hell to serve Lucifer as his army. One of them, Mazikeen, became Lucifer's best friend, bodyguard, and loyal soldier,[14] who he trusted enough to tell her about his twin Michael.[5] As a result, Lucifer owed Lilith a favor.[16]

Lucifer reluctantly ruled Hell for millennia, gaining an incredibly fearsome and terrifying reputation as the personification of evil, conceived in many cultures and religious traditions. He became known by many names and titles, including the Devil, Satan, Beelzebub, Old Scratch,[4] Abaddon, Belial, Prince of Darkness,[3] the Dark Lord, the Prince of Lies, and the Lord of Temptation. Though despising many of them, Lucifer actually liked Old Scratch.[4] He, however, came to despise his birthname, reminding him of his fall from grace.[3] His relationship with Azrael soured, as he felt like she abandoned him, never bothering to visit him while in Hell.[9]

Tempting Eve

Sometime after his fall, Lucifer met the first Humans, Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden. There, he introduced them to the knowledge between good and evil by eating the fruit from the Tree of Life.[1] While having a fling with Eve, Lucifer asked the first woman the one question no-one else bothered to ask her; if being Adam's wife was what she truly desired. His interest in what she wanted resulted in a close friendship with Eve. These acts, however, angered God enough to banish Adam and Eve from Eden and send them to Earth to live out there days.[17]

When they had two sons, Cain and Abel, and the latter was murdered by his brother, he was sent to Hell and became it's first tenant.[18] After that, Lucifer became aware of Cain becoming the "World's First Murderer" and how he was cursed by his Father to walk Earth for a "tortured eternity."[19] When Humanity grew in numbers, Lucifer commanded the Demons to stop possessing the bodies of deceased damned souls[20], not wanting them to cause havoc on Earth, killing Humans before their time. The punishment for disobeying him was incineration.[21]

Giving his Mom the Cold Shoulder

Hundred years later, Goddess became a prisoner of Hell when she began causing plagues and floods.[22] After she was locked in Her cell, Lucifer never bothered to visit his Mother, giving Her the same cold shoulder that She gave him when God banished him.[1]

Visits to Earth

Socializing with Humanity

Throughout the centuries, Lucifer would occasionally visit Earth, only for Amenadiel to always come to take Lucifer back to Hell.[23] In 1583 BC before the common era, Lucifer was responsible for the burning bush Moses encountered.[24] Lucifer befriended King Tutankhamen of Egypt before his death in 1323 BC and engaged in a "human train" orgy with Caligula numbering 37 people.[16] He spent time with Atilla the Hun, developing a fondness for Hungarian rum balls.[25]

Between 1599-1601, he gave constructive criticism to William Shakespeare while he was writing Hamlet, and was gifted a signed copy of one of his books as a thanks.[26] He reunited with Lilith in 1793 where the two attended Marie Antoinette's "coming out party" that led to her beheading.[16] Even though Lucifer "de-pantsed" Napoleon with Jophiel[12], he received a horse statue from the dictator.[27] He attended Sigmund Freud's bris in 1856[28] and became close friends with him[16], being gifted his personal journal before he died.[21] In 1892, he met writer Oscar Wilde and became a lover to the "interesting bachelor." He gave him a quote about the stars that Oscar used in his hit play Lady Windermere's Fan. He came to regret giving him the quote, growing annoyed by all the people quoting it back to him.[29] Sometime before Grigori Rasputin's death, Lucifer started a "private club for magicians" with him that angered the Romanovs.[30]

When a certain masochist went to Hell, Lucifer took part in his torture. He tortured him in every way he requested; burning, freezing, or simply hurting. However, after centuries, the soul mysteriously missed his daily punishment. However, when he returned from one of his trips to Earth for their next session of torture, the King of Hell was surprised to see the soul crying, begging he never forget him again, promising to be good. It was in that moment Lucifer realized this individual was so full of self-loathing and voided of self-respect that whatever attention he paid him gave meaning to his "pointless existence," regardless of the manners of torture he inflicted on him.[31]

He avoided Franz Kafka's Hell Loop due to it being the most depressing.[16] Either before or during World War II, he visited Nazi Germany and mingled with them.[25] He reserved burning crotches for them and pedophiles,[24] and eventually developed a dislike of listening to Adolf Hitler's screams.[27] At some point after the war, Lucifer acquired a 22-bedroom castle in Austria that "hardly got bombed" during the conflict and met private investigator Jack Monroe after his tour at the Battle of the Bulge.[16]

Lucifer hated the rumor that associated him with goats, never figuring out how it started,[32] as he doesn't "even like their cheese." He grew to despise Satanists, who worshipped how he is perceived as in The Bible; embodiment of evil.[33]

Repaying His Debt

Reuniting with an Old Friend

By the year 1946, having not seen Lilith for 253 years, Lucifer was summoned by his old friend to New York City to get a drink at the club she worked at as a singer, the Garden Club. While traveling to Earth, Lucifer didn't arrive at the Garden Club exactly so was given a ride to the Big City. Once they arrived a block away from the club, he stepped out of the car, making a few flirtatious looks at women before skipping on to the street to his destination.

Making his way inside, he took a drink from a passing waitress and stopped at the club's bar. He didn't have to wait long for Lilith to take the stage and start singing I Want to Be Evil. When she references The Devil in the song, Lucifer chuckles and says to a patron that she was talking about him. He then enjoyed the rest of the show. After she finished, he raised a glass to her performance when she winked at him, then gulped it down.

Lucifer then moved towards her as she left the stage before he was halted by Paddy and Vincenzo of the clubs employees questioning what his intentions were with Tommy Stompanato's girlfriend. Lilith soon arrived to stop the potential conflict that would end with the men being beaten by Lucifer. He snickered at her implication about being the victor of the fight and two old friends left for her dressing room to talk in private.

Pouring them drinks while she changed, Lucifer recounted the last time they saw each other was at Marie Antoinette's beheading, commenting on what a shame it was that she was executed. He then questioned what Lilith had been up to in the last few hundred years, only to be saddened to hear that the ring that she took from the Garden of Eden before she was banished by his Father was recently stolen.

Lucifer opted to cheer her up, such as seeing Ernie Hemingway while he was in town. However, Lilith's change of attire confused him, believing they couldn't go out with her low cut backless black dressing gown. She instead deemed they were going to get the "only thing in the entire Universe that means anything" to her back, but he questioned why he would involve himself. Calling in her favor of sending her children to him, he agreed, calling the idea of The Devil solving crime ridiculous.[16]

Working with Jack Monroe

Needing professional help in finding Lilith's ring, Lucifer thought Jack Monroe was the best person to aide him. He let himself in to his P.I.'s office, where Jack greeted him asking what he wanted. He informed him of the missing ring, showing him the image of it on Lilith's ring from one of her posters. When Jack seemed disinterested in helping, Lucifer dropped a stack of cash to motivate him, which worked.

He took Jack back to the Garden Club to begin their search. He assured Jack that he could handle himself when the private investigator told him to let him deal with any trouble that came their way, but relented when he brought up his time in WWII. He then asked what "ne'er-do-well" they should interview first. Jack nodes to the bartender, Gertie, and the duo questioned her knowledge on the ring's location.

The bartender gave them information on a man dubbed "Lucky Larry" snooping around Lilith's dressing room when her ring disappeared. When she gave them his description ending with an eyepatch, Lucifer became annoyed that she didn't lead with that detail. Lucifer and Jack scour the bar for Larry, only for the latter to spot a mustache man that he believed was a "rat just dying to squeal." Lucifer was ordered to stay at the bar while he talked with him, so he had himself a drink Gertie poured him.

With Benny only being willing to talk out back, Lucifer and Jack rendezvoused with the snitch outside, only to see no sign of him. Lucifer figured he "turned tail and ran," but as Jack predicted, the man showed up behind them. Unfortunately, this turned out to be a setup and the two were ambushed by Paddy and Vincenzo, the latter sucker punching Jack. Lucifer asked the injured Jack if he still wanted him to stay out of the fight, feeling it was "unsporting" for him to do nothing.

He, however, changed his mind when Jack started fighting back. Before Lucifer could assist, the sound of whistling behind the men halted the fight. Coming out of the shadows was Tommy Stompanato, who threatened them with their lives if they kept asking questions in his club. He then turned his gaze towards Lucifer, deeming him lucky to be friends with "Lily Rose," but demanded he not get "too friendly" with her. This just made Lucifer chuckle at his threat.

Returning to Jack's P.I.'s office, Lucifer and Jack sat on the latter's coach where he was scorned for not helping Jack when he was punched. He defended his actions as obliging to his promise to not interfere with any fights. Taking a sip of alcohol straight from the bottle, he asked what their next move was. With the plan to check out Lucky Larry's usual hiding places in the morning, Lucifer decided to take this opportunity to "trip the light fantastic" with New York's "best and brightest."[16]

Investigating Lucky Larry's Murder

Lucifer's night on the town was interrupted, unfortunately, when Lucky Larry dropped dead with a knife in his back at Jack's house. He arrived at the scene, with the NYPD already securing it. He began flirting with Jack's wife, Shirley Monroe in the dining room while her husband was on the phone with his informant. He offered to have some fun, but she remained faithful to her husband and politely declined.

They were joined by Jack, who warned Lucifer to stay away from his wife. He, however, figured Jack wouldn't mind since he noticed the man hadn't spoken to his wife since he arrived. Changing the topic to Larry's murder, Lucifer was informed that he got into a fight with a bratwurst heir dubbed "Willy the Sausage Prince" at the docks yesterday; Lucifer made a crack at the man's nickname. H then took note of the tension between Jack and Shirley when the man decided to stay at his office for the night before they went to question Willy.

On the way to the Sausage Prince's mansion, Lucifer asked what his wife did to get his "trousers in such a twist," only to discover that she was a call girl his army friends hired to go on a date with him. Lucifer believed Jack was a lucky man to benefit from the experience that Shirley had gained from the men she was with before him. Jack, however, didn't see the appeal, so Lucifer questioned why he didn't just leave her if it bothered him so much.

Jack gave his explanation as still being in love with her, but voiced his doubts in his future with her due to their relationship starting off with a lie. Lucifer wasn't paying attention, finding his situation "extraordinarily boring." He gave his advice to just forget about it, comparing problems to the likes of Bible salesmen and genital warts, but Jack just laughed at Lucifer's absurd advice.

The two finally arrived at the mansion where they interrupted William in the middle of having a self portrait of himself in a suit of armor done. Being offered mini sausages and tea by William's maid, Carmina, the duo sat down on his coach. Noting Segmund having a "field day" with the Sausage Prince, Lucifer demanded the location of Lilith's ring before searching the mansion himself when William claimed not to know what he was talking about.

While Jack questioned the details of Willy's fight with Lucky Larry, Lucifer scoured the living room for the ring, but stopped to tell Willy that Larry stole his friend's ring and ended up murdered when he questioned why his fight with him was so important. He then resumed his search for the ring, even searching in a knight's armor's private section while Willy gave Jack the details of his relationship with Larry.

Seeing the ring wasn't in the living room, Lucifer rejoined Jack as Willy told them how upset he was that Larry had them meet out on the docks, believing he stepped in feces. William's dimwitted attitude made Lucifer believe that he didn't have the brains to steal Lilith's ring; Jack agreed with Lucifer's assessment. After being given the location of Larry's apartment, Lucifer took one last look at Willy, believing there was a word to describe him but couldn't figure it out. He then left with Jack.

Lucifer and Jack entered Larry's apartment, Lucifer disgusted by the esthetic of the place, deeming it worse then Kafka's Hell Loop. While searching the apartment was a bust, Lucifer and Jack did "role play" of Larry's murder, Lucifer being the murderer. They were able to deduce that the killer stabbed Larry in the back while he tried to flee out the window, which created the blood splatter on it. Lucifer then discovered the tip of a Romeo y Julieta cigar that pointed them to Tommy Stompanato.[16]

Reaching a Dead End

They arrived at Stompanato's mansion where Lucifer questioned if Tommy murdered Larry and stole the ring back to impress Lilith, why hadn't he given her it back. The duo peered around a statue to see blood dripping from the staircase railing forming a buddle. They reached the railing to find Vincenzo murdered. Lucifer and Jack made it to Tommy's room to find him lying in his bed, heart ripped out and a Anubis mask covering his face.

Lucifer removed the mask to find a Eye of Horus painted over his left eye. While Lucifer looked for Tommy's missing heart on the floor, Jack discovered an identical knife to the one that killed Lucky Larry. Lucifer then discovered the ring case, only to be disappointed to find it empty. When asked what the symbol on his face was, Lucifer confirmed it as the hieroglyphic for the Eye of Horus. This gave Jack the idea to visit the Sacred Eye Book Store.

Entering the book store, they looked around before being startled by one of the employees. Fooling the employee that they were there to attend the secret cult ceremony, Lucifer and Jack dressed in spare robes and entered a room full of knockoff sacred objects. They were again startled by the owner of the book store, Melvin the Magnificent, annoying Lucifer. He then requested a Ceremony of Anubis, which Melvin obliged.

He asked them to look to their right, and while they did, the backdrop of the Tree of Life changed into one portraying the pyramids with the Eye of Horus symbol on it; Lucifer was baffled at how the magician pulled that off. As he listed off what came with the package, Lucifer commented it never ending well for the chicken in sacrificial ceremonies. When he then offered the "economy package" that had a chicken heart pre-sacrificed. Lucifer didn't find it quite accurate, but figured Tutankhamen would've loved it.

When Melvin started talking about death being power, Lucifer and Jack believed they found Tommy's murderer, so Lucifer used his Desire Exhibition on him to glean what he most wanted. He was, however, confused to hear it be a 1941 Pontiac Torpedo. Having enough of Melvin's games, Lucifer accused him of killing Tommy and stealing Lilith's "very special ring." Melvin, unfortunately had an alibi of being here during Stompanato's murder window.

Jack then asked if he told any of his customers about the legend of Lilith's ring. Melvin confirmed to selling maps to Lilith's tomb for years but couldn't give them a name due to them all wearing robes that covered their faces. With this leading them to a dead end, Lucifer referred to their time with Melvin the Magnificent as a "clucking waste of time."[16]

Luring Out the Thief

Lucifer relayed the bad news to Lilith at her dressing room and tried to offer other ways to repay his debt now that there seemed to be no way to find the thief. Lilith still wasn't willing to give up on the ring as it reminded her of who she was and why she did the things that she did. Lucifer asked if that included sending her children to Hell, which only made her furious that Lucifer didn't appreciate the army she gave him; he shouted that he never asked for said army.

However, after lowering his voice, he called them the one he never knew he needed as without them he would've spent his eternity in Hell alone. He told Lilith that he would forever be in her debt for giving him the only company he had in Hell and apologized that he couldn't get her ring back to repay his debt. With them both getting a drink, Lucifer sat on Lilith's coach and inquired how Humanity got it in there heads that it was her ring that gave her Immortality.

She took a seat opposite to him and revealed that after ditching the "wet blanket" Hernn Corts in the Americas, she found herself in the company of Moctezuma before she was thrown into a volcano by his priests and when she survived, it was written on a stone tablet. This made Lucifer laugh at the mortals ways to explain the Celestial world. He then got the idea that since the ring wouldn't work, the thief would look for a way to make it work, coming up with a plan to fulfill his debt.

He had a "high priest-cum-magic school freshman" that he knew spread the word that Lilith's ring would only work if its attached to a "gaudy bangle" he had a jeweler make. He placed the bracelet on Lilith's right arm and briefed her on the plan: while she's on stage, Shirley will take the bangle to her dressing room's safe, where the thief will sneak in, only for Jack to be watching the entire time. He was confidant that by the end of the night the "little piece of Eden" will be returned to her.

While waiting for the show to start, Lucifer was asked by Lilith if he'd ever connected with a Human during his many trips to Earth. Lucifer assumed she was referring to sex and started to brag about his orgy with Caligula, but she cut him off and clarified she was talking about an emotional connection. Disgusted by the notion, Lucifer believed it would take a miracle for him to want that and figured it would never happen as his Father wasn't "handing those out" anymore.

As part of the plan, Lucifer would accompany Lilith in a duet as a distraction for Jack to scope the crowd for the person who left to follow Shirely. After she handed the bangle to Shirley to place in her safe, he played the piano while Lilith started singing Someone to Watch Over Me. When she sat beside him, the two then started singing the remainder of the song together.

After the performance, Lucifer and Lilith arrived in the dressing room, only to find Jack aiming his gun at Willy, who had the bangle. Lucifer was taken aback by this development, as he believed he didn't have it in him to kill Stompanato. They were then joined by Gertie, who aimed her tommy gun at them from behind, revealing she was the one who hired Lucky Larry to steal Lilith's ring.

She revealed her master plan to use the ring to save her husband, Bill from his cancer as she assumed it was the ring that saved Lilith from being killed after being caught in the crossfire between the Stompanato Boys and the Brooklyn Bridge Gang. Lucifer had enough of this "ringamorale" and shot Willy in the foot with Jack's gun to prove the ring doesn't grant immortality. As expected, Willy screamed out in agony and while Lilith and Gertie talked about why she did all this, Lucifer and Jack tended to William.[16]

Saying Goodbye to Lilith

As Lucifer and Lilith watched Willy hulled away in a police car, Jack approached them asking if they either blame Stompanato for Gertie's crimes or arrest Gertie herself. They glanced at Gertie sitting by two officers and, feeling sympathy for her, chose the former so she can spend whatever time her husband has left with him. Lucifer was then left alone with Jack, who complimented their teamwork despite him being a "odd duck." They tipped their hats in farewell and went their separate ways.

Later, he and Lilith stood alone in a street corner, where he recounted the current events and how he has finally repaid his debt to her. He bid farewell till their next reunion in a couple hundred years, but Lilith declined. Thinking she was referring to living up his debt, Lucifer offered his castle in Austria, but she still declined, saying that Gertie was right in having a mortal life that made a connection meaningful.

Much to Lucifer's surprise, she decided to give up her immortality. Lilith put her immortality in the ring, turning the white rock black, and offers it to Lucifer. Taking it, he reminded her that there would be no going back once she goes through with this, but she remained steadfast in her decision, asking for one more thing from Lucifer.

Though annoyed that "it never ends" with her, he asked if she would like him to bring her children up to say her goodbyes. Scowling, she blandly declined, not wanting all the hard work she put in making them perfect to be undone. She made Lucifer promise to never to tell them what happened to her. They gave each other a heartfelt last goodbye before Lucifer returned to Hell and Lilith went to live a normal life. Lucifer would never take the ring off, as it reminded him of his oldest friend.[16]

Magic Castle Member

When the Magic Castle opened in Los Angeles on January 2, 1963, Lucifer became a member on the day it opened its doors. In 1971, he refereed a drinking competition between Dai Vernon and David Copperfield, but couldn't resist competing, and ended up winning.[30]

Faking The King's Death

In 1977, Lucifer made a deal with Elvis Presley to help him fake his death, presumably helping him get a new identity. Lucifer became the sole individual to know where "The King" relocated to.[34]

Celebrating the End of the 90s

Having despised the 1990s with its frosted tips, dial-ups, and Creed, Lucifer never visited Earth during that time. The one exception was to celebrate the decades' end. During the '99 Falcons/Broncos Super Bowl in Miami, he had an orgy with 36 people for 15 minutes. During that time he used his desire mojo to bring out Esther Barnum's desires to be a rabbi.[28] This would be the last time Lucifer visited Earth for 12 years of its time.[23]

Moving to Earth

Vacation to Los Angeles

In 2011, Lucifer decided to take another leave from ruling Hell and landed on a beach in Los Angeles, eventually moving there.[35]

Deal with Amenadiel

Needing the help of his demon soldier, friend, and servant, Mazikeen, to help locate Amenadiel's lost necklace, Lucifer made a deal with John Constantine of Earth-1 to get her out; thus Lucifer owed Constantine a favor.[36] Following the retrieval of the necklace, Lucifer cashed in the favor Amenadiel owed him to leave him and Mazikeen alone on Earth.[23]

Severing Ties with his Old Life

To ensure he could not be tempted to return to Hell, Lucifer rendezvoused with Maze at the beach he landed on when he arrived and ordered her to sever his wings. Sharing an intense gaze with her, he unfurled his Angelic wings and kneeled on the ground. Lucifer held in the pain he felt as Maze sliced through his skin, and gazed up at the sky. He gritted his teeth in a defiant grin for his Father, signifying him leaving his old life behind as his wings fell to the ground.[23]

Lucifer then opened the nightclub Lux with Maze's assistance.[14] He stored his wings in a container and housed it in a warehouse.[3] Now a resident of L.A., Lucifer went to Neil Palmer to retrieve the falsified paperwork he required to be a legal citizen without having been born on Earth.[37] Sometime later, he met Ozzy Osbourne and granted a great many favors for him.[5]

Anti-Monitor Crisis

Some years later, Lucifer became aware of the Anti-Monitor Crisis impacting the Multiverse, but was indifferent toward the situation. As he was leaving Lux through the back with two women, he found Constantine and his two compatriots waiting for him. With Constantine here to collect on the favor he owed him, he had the ladies return to the bar so he could conduct his business.

Enthusiastically greeting "Johnny," Lucifer was less then thrilled to see the warlock outside his bar on his Earth. Noticing Mia Smoak's beauty, Lucifer introduced himself as The Devil, though Mia didn't believe him, and used his mojo to discover what she truly desired. Learning that it was to save her father, Lucifer related with it being "daddy issues," just like him and his Father.

Getting back on the topic of why they were here, Lucifer learned they need his help in retrieving Oliver Queen's soul from Purgatory. Shrugging off the urgency of the current Crisis, he agreed to aide the trio, only because of Constantine helping Maze get to Earth. Before providing his assistance, he locked eyes with John Diggle and noted his "tall, dark, annoyed by [him]," demeanor reminded him of Amenadiel.

Diggle demanded he cut out his foolishness and help them which only made Lucifer become attracted to his demeanor towards him. Always living up to his deals, Lucifer gifted them a Purgatory Teleportation Card to use to save Oliver's soul. He, however, warned them that they only had a limited time within Purgatory and their souls would be destroyed if they didn't return to the mortal plane before the card of him playing a piano with his Devil face faded away.

He bid "Constantyne" and his compatriots farewell, giving one last flirtatious look at Mia before returning to his activities as normal. After the Multiverse was destroyed, Lucifer returned to his life as normal once the Paragons and Spectre rebooted the Multiverse at the Dawn of Time; though Lucifer's history was altered so that he personally brought Maze to Earth.[36]

By 2016, Lucifer had settled into a hedonistic lifestyle in Los Angeles revolving around running Lux and making Faustian deals with various people in various industries in exchange for favors. But then one night he witnessed the murder of a close acquaintance. Lacking faith in the L.A.P.D., Lucifer inserted himself into the investigation, working with homicide detective Chloe Decker. After the case was solved, Lucifer decided to continue working with Chloe as an LAPD Civilian Consultant.

Throughout the Series

This section is a stub. You can help by expanding it.

At the start of the "Pilot", Lucifer is pulled over for speeding. After bribing his way out, he continues to his nightclub, Lux. Later that evening, burnt-out singer, and old friend Delilah visits Lux to see Lucifer, and asks him if she had sold her soul to the Devil. He laughed and said that would imply the Devil was interested in her soul, that all her choices were on her. He then called in his favor telling her it would be difficult for her; "Pull yourself together," then said she was wasting her talent, her life. As he walks her down the street, they are gunned down by a low-level drug dealer, and it kills Delilah, but merely angers Lucifer.

Lacking faith in the LAPD, which he calls a corrupt organization, Lucifer takes matters into his own hands and follows up on some leads of his own, which inevitably causes him to cross paths with detective, Chloe Decker, who had previously interviewed Lucifer as the witness to the shooting. Lucifer convinces her to allow him to accompany her on the investigation when he has leads for her to follow, though she remains oblivious to his true identity. Lucifer was vaguely disturbed and fascinated to find Chloe was immune to his "charms".

The investigation leads the duo to Delilah's producer, who reveals he had her killed to benefit from skyrocketing sales of her album after her death. Chloe shoots the armed producer who wounded then shoots Chloe. He also shoots Lucifer six times to no effect, while a dazed and frightened Chloe watches. Lucifer picks up the producer by the neck turns him to face the mirror and vows to punish him severely, leaving his fate ambiguous. Lucifer later visits Chloe at the hospital and tells her he's glad she's not dead. Amenadiel confronts him about the consequences of his actions, and the two snarl at each other and part.

In "Once Upon a Time", God presents an alternate universe that was completely identical to the original universe up to John Decker's murder. In this alternate reality John survived the ambush that would have killed him, and progressed to detective lieutenant in his career. Chloe remained an actress, starring as cop, Bonnie Generro, in four action movies, the result being Lucifer and Chloe did not meet on the night of Delilah's murder, and it was never properly solved by a lazy and corrupt Dan Espinoza. Lucifer remained an aloof and arrogant club owner, and in 2018 was planning to expand Lux to Las Vegas, with the aid of his lawyer Charlotte Richards. The Devil and the actress teamed up to solve the murder of her stuntman friend, with God pointing out sometimes it doesn't matter the circumstances, some are always drawn to the same people every time.

Demon Uprising

Returning to Normal

After placing Monopolize in holding, Lucifer and Chloe were approached by Ella who revealed an image of Halla still alive coming out of a Pazo Papollo's Pizza delivery car. He and Ella figured it was all a publicity stunt, to which Chloe agreed and suggested Lucifer go home and rest since there was no murder to solve. Agreeing with his partner, Lucifer hoped for a murder tomorrow to solve and headed back to Lux.[21]

An Unholy Reunion

After the unexpected reunion, Lucifer returned to his penthouse and went to sleep on his sofa. He was awoken by Maze and Chloe. He questioned if he was still dreaming, but quickly realized he wasn't as the two women weren't naked. He then became annoyed that they woke him up just to tell him what he already knew about Demons being loose in Los Angeles and how Kinley sent them as a way to prevent the prophecy.

He assured them that he "sent them packing" and revealed said roaming Demons were the incompetent Dromos and Squee, which Maze shared his hatred with them, particularly Squee. While Maze went to make sure they returned to Hell, Lucifer went to get a drink from the decanter on the piano. He was then stunned by Chloe's suggestion he leave L.A. for a while, fearing the prophecy was really about Demons coming to the city.

Lucifer then asked how she and Maze got into this investigation in the first place but was shocked to hear that she was following a lead on Kinley without him. Interpreting this as Chloe still being afraid of him despite their progress in their relationship, Lucifer refused to listen to Chloe try to explain and suggested she leave. However, Chloe soon got a text, and much to Lucifer's horror, he found out that Charlie had been kidnapped.[21]

Charlie's Kidnapping

The duo arrived at the penthouse, with Lucifer failing to get in touch with Amenadiel and Maze. He and Chloe were then greeted by the site of his home being trashed. Lucifer became furious, believing this was more retribution from the Demons by lashing out on his penthouse. However, after Chloe figured the Demons were in fact searching for something, Lucifer noticed his safe was open.

Upon searching through its contents, Lucifer found that Kinley's vile was the only thing missing. When questioned why he kept it, he defended his actions as wanting to dispose of properly. He then came to the horrible realization that the Demons weren't seeking vengeance on him, but rather planning on replacing him with Charlie as Hell's new King, explaining how it can only be ruled by a Celestial.

They were then interrupted by Eve. Lucifer, however, was in no mood to deal with her desires to get back with him, and insisted she leave, before she revealed she had something on Dromos. Now all ears, Lucifer was dumbfounded to hear that Eve was the one who not only broke Kinley out of jail but was responsible for summoning Dromos into his body all in a misguided attempt to get him back. While furious with Eve putting his nephew in danger, Lucifer remained calm and asked where Charlie was. Unfortunately, Eve had no knowledge of where they were.

Despite this setback, Lucifer and Chloe realized that the Demons were performing the ritual Kinley planned on him for Charlie. Still sore over Chloe's initial betrayal, Lucifer bitterly asked Chloe where Kinley planned on banishing him back to Hell, only to become annoyed that their search radius was narrowed down to the 2 to 3,000 churches in L.A.

Fortunately, upon further description from Chloe and Eve remembering Squee talking about one of the old civilizations, they were able to piece together they were headed to the "oxymoronic venue" of The Mayan to perform the ritual. With a location they headed to the elevator, but Lucifer, still angry at Eve for her recklessness, ordered her to stay in the penthouse so not to cause any more damage and left.[21]

Battle at the Myan

Lucifer and Chloe returned to the precinct to wrap the case up. However, Ella came over to them at the former's desk voicing her confusion as to why many of the bodies that were at The Myan were thrashed. The two attempted to cover it up as the victims of Kinsley's supposed cult being into "downright demonic" stuff, which Ella decided to go with despite the evidence saying the bodies died twice.

After she left, Lucifer voiced his belief that if it weren't for Ella's forensic skills, he would've lost his "half-angel nephew." He then shared Chloe's frustration of not being able to tell their friend the truth but reminded her of Humanity's less than ideal reactions to discovering that the Celestial world existed, even if they believed deep down like Ella did.[38]

A Heartbreaking Goodbye

Lucifer then returned to Lux, where he realized that he had to return to Hell to keep the Demons in line or else they would revolt again. He stood out in his balcony, observing the city he had come to call his home when Chloe approached him to let him know Charlie was home. She asked if it was over, and though Lucifer wanted say yes, he couldn't as it would be a lie.

He turned towards her and confirmed that they won tonight's battle, but it was just stopping "one hole in a very flimsy boat." He explains that with the Demons now knowing he had no intentions of returning as Hell's king they would continue to rebel and probably make another attempt at Charlie or even Chloe herself as a means to hurt him.

Lucifer then told the distraught Chloe that she was right about the prophecy being about Hell coming to Earth and that to prevent it from coming true, he had to return to Hell to make the Demons toe the line. Much to his surprise, Chloe confessed her love for him and tried to convince him to stay. Though overjoyed to hear Chloe's feelings revealed, Lucifer remained committed to keep his loved ones safe.

Before he departed, he wiped the tears from Chloe's cheek and tells her that the priests were wrong about another part of the prophecy; Eve wasn't his first love, Chloe was and always has been. The two then kissed each other in a passionate goodbye kiss. Departing, Lucifer bid his first love a heartbreaking goodbye after she begged one more time for him to stay with her.

He then unfurls his restored angelic wings, now feeling worthy of them once again. He raised a hand to Chloe's cheek and said goodbye one last time before leaving her and everyone he loved forever. Sitting on his towering throne alone, Lucifer overlooked the grim, ash-covered realm of Hell, resuming his duties as its sovereign once again.[21]

Reestablished Ruler of Hell

An Unexpected New Resident

Lucifer is resigned when he returns to Hell, telling himself it's his duty to keep humanity safe, but he still longs for Los Angeles and to be reunited with the Detective. In an attempt to feel close to her again, he helps a newcomer to Hell solve his own murder for old times' sake.[39] Due to his position in the underworld, Lucifer is successful in gaining leads in the case, and when the opportunity arises, he sends Gromos to Earth to deliver those clues to Chloe through a recently dead killer.[39]

Lucifer reveals to the soul - Lee Garner - that souls punish themselves with their own guilt, and that no one is able to work through it. He visits Lee in the man's Hell loop and points out where the man's guilt lies, before departing to his throne. [39] Despite his desire to return to Earth, Lucifer remains in Hell.[39]

Returning to Earth

Learning of Michael's Schemes

After departing with Lee in his Hell Loop, Lucifer wondered the corridors alone, when to his surprise, Amenadiel approached him. Though Lucifer was happy to see his eldest brother after all this time in Hell, he questioned why he was being paid this visit. He became concerned when Amenadiel's response was just that the time had come for Lucifer to return, knowing he wouldn't be asking for his help unless something serious had happened. Worried for Chloe's safety, Lucifer demanded to know what has happened in his absence.[5]

Lucifer agrees to return to Earth to deal with Michael, leaving Amenadiel in charge if Hell while he's away.[34]

A Not So Happy Reunion

When he reappeared at the precinct, where he thought "burnt coffee and body odor never smelled so good" he had to convince Chloe he was Lucifer and not Michael, and after a heartfelt embrace she informed him Michael told her she was a gift from God, then was furious when Lucifer could not deny it, and had never told her, their reunion was ruined.

Lucifer begins working with Decker again, but finds that he has also alienated Mazikeen, who attacks him in a rage for not taking her back to Hell with him. He remarks that she's no longer his servant and can return to Hell whenever she wishes, and that she could have asked Amenadiel to transport her.[34]

Brother vs Brother

Lucifer eventually meets with his brother, Michael, and the two talk. Michael needles Lucifer's fears and chronic paranoia, suggesting all his actions, from the rebellion to the LA vacay, have been influenced by Michael's whispers. The two viciously fight, and when Lucifer gains the upper hand he tells Michael his next action was his decision alone, and carves a scar his face with one of Mazikeen's blades.[34]

Story Time at the Penthouse

Lucifer still wanted to make things right with Chloe before he returned to Hell, so he invited her and Trixie to one of their game nights; Chloe never answered. Despite this, Lucifer got his penthouse ready for them, setting out a Monopoly board, food, and wine on the table. Hearing the elevator ring, he greeted the "ladies," only to find Trixie had arrived without her mother.

Upon hearing that Trixie was staying with Dan for the night, Lucifer became worried about Chloe's mental state and asked if she had spoken to her about being a gift from God, but she wasn't interested in "grown-up problems." With Trixie already here, Lucifer offered the two of them play Monopoly anyway, but she declined, deeming it no fun with only two people.[16]

Changes

In Detective Amenadiel, Chloe's struggle with the concept of 'gift from God' is finally resolved with the help of Amenadiel who tells her that the "gift" is not Chloe, but the fact that Chloe is the only mortal who can see Lucifer for who he truly is, and in turn, he chose to be vulnerable around her. She then went to Lucifer and told him if he chose to be vulnerable around her "I choose to be vulnerable around you."

After Lucifer and Chloe finally consummate their relationship, despite their happiness in each other, it's discovered that Chloe can mojo Lucifer and Lucifer finds that he is no longer able to draw out people's desires. The loss shakes Lucifer, who has never had to share before, and worries Chloe when he can't stop obsessing, and tells him that maybe it's a good thing, perhaps he has finally allowed her to make the tiniest dent in the huge wall he has built around himself.

Following the loss of his "mojo", Lucifer feels he is useless in the partnership with Chloe, given he no longer contributes anything, but she points out his many contributions including the fact that he can speak all languages, and he is her own version of a Swiss Army Knife. The two settle things between them with Lucifer acknowledging "what I call powerlessness is what everyone else calls Tuesday." Daniel then interrupts them and shoots Lucifer on Michael's orders after Michael had orchestrated Dan finally seeing a glimpse of his brother's devil face previously.[40] Lucifer, much to his and Chloe's shock, is no longer vulnerable, even around Chloe, and he is able to withstand the impact of the bullet.[41]

Sibling Squabble

After Michael subverts Mazikeen by telling her about Lucifer keeping a secret about Lilith from her, Lucifer loses Mazikeen's allegiance, and she aligns herself with Michael. When the angels on Earth finally get down to battle, Lucifer and Amenadiel fight Maze and Michael. The battle is interrupted, however, when God appears on Earth to stop the fighting between his children.[41]

He and his brothers staggered at the sight of their Father in Human form before they all furled their wings. In response to Michael trying to play the victim of their conflict, Lucifer sarcastically remarked that as always he was responsible for anything bad and told their Father to blame him as He always did. He was then frustrated that Amenadiel chose to take full responsibility due to his stature as the eldest.

Lucifer snarked at the idea of being civil with his twin after God voiced His desire for His children to get along. He was then revolted as Michael embraced Amenadiel in his attempt to stay on their Father's good side. When Michael attempted to give him a hug, Lucifer refuses outright and vehemently. As he attempted to leave, the sound of his Father referring to him Samael made him stop in his tracks.

Furious with both Michael and God, Lucifer listed all the despicable things his twin had done while on Earth, but was unable to call Chloe his love when he recounted him kidnapping her. He then exclaimed how Michael orchestrated his downfall and berated his Father for not being able to stop anything he did despite being omnipotent. With one last look at Amenadiel, Lucifer left the precinct in a huff.[6]

Battle for Supremacy

Declaration of War

With LeMec taken care of, Lucifer went to Linda that night for a session over recent events. He started by informing her that he and Maze made LeMec and his crew suffer for killing Dan. When asked how that made him feel, he deemed his feelings were irrelevant compared to Dan's death. He then chuckled at Linda's astute observation of how important the grieving process was.

He complimented Linda on how good she was at her job, but believed that a therapist job shouldn't consist. He then clarified that he thought pain shouldn't exist entirely when Linda asked if he was referring to someone helping people cope. Lucifer then lost his temper when Linda said that pain was inevitable, but suffering was optional. He tells her that the system his Father established was broken.

He expresses his despair of Trixie having to suffer the loss of her father in such a horrific way. Then as he was about to reveal that Dan was in Hell, Lucifer decided to follow Amenadiel's decision and just deem that Dan shouldn't be dead in the first place. Lucifer deems the God's system has not only broken, but unjust. Lucifer was then told that it was impossible for him to control all the bad in the world, just how it affected him

Lucifer, however, said that Linda was wrong in what he could do. He confesses that he wanted to be God for the wrong reason in proving himself worthy of Chloe. However, after what Michael has done to claim the throne, he no longer wanted to be God, rather, he had to be God. Linda asked what he meant. Lucifer answered by declaring war on Michael for the throne of Heaven.[12]

The New God

Despite being seemingly incinerated for violating his banishment, Lucifer was mysteriously resurrected. He called down to Chloe to stop her from vengefully eradicating Michael with the Blade of Death and flew down next to her. Furling his wings, he reminded his girlfriend that this rage wasn't her and was given the blade to render judgement on to his twin.

He ordered his shocked brother to take a knee and face his sentencing. Lucifer reignited the Flaming Sword after the others arrived at the arched entrance to see the conclusion of the battle and Michael extended his wings in acceptance of his execution. However, Lucifer instead sliced Michael's wings off, declaring that there would be no more killing, giving Amenadiel a small nod, to which he returned.

Lucifer decided to grant his twin brother a second chance, having learned in his time on Earth that everyone deserved one, even people like the two of them. Chloe questioned how Lucifer survived, but he was just as surprised as she was. He then looked toward his gathered siblings and allies and became confused when Amenadiel took a knee before him, followed by his allies, brothers and sisters, and even Michael.

With everyone, minus Chloe, bowing before him, Lucifer finally came to the realization that he had succeeded in proving his worth having risked sacrificing his life to revive Chloe, and thus, his banishment from Heaven was lifted. He shakenly raised the Flaming Sword to signify his victory, slightly grinning at his success in taking their Father's place as the new Ruler of the Universe. Now the new deity, Lucifer looked on at his new subjects and muttered a "Oh, my me!", unsure of what to do next.[13]

Aftermath

Shortly after the battle, Lucifer imprisoned Michael in Hell to scrub its floors as a way to repent for his crimes on Earth.[42] He also freed Dan from his Hell-Loop, ordering the Demons not to torture him. He placed him in his own little Purgatory, playing ping-pong with Belios in a replication of the LAPD bullpen, while trying to help him figure out what lingering guilt he had that kept him from reaching Heaven.[30] He chose not to bring Dan back up to Earth as a Ghost to figure out his guilt because he knew it would've been more torturous for him to be around all his Human loved ones, especially Trixie, and not be able to interact with them.[28]
